I personally believe that it is not a straightforward answer that sex at fourteen is right or wrong. It is much more complicated than that.
 
 On one hand, you can say that sex is ok at the age fourteen if the person is physically, mentally, emotionally and please note FISCALLY ready for it. It is like this, you must be able to stand the consequences of your own actions, whether it may be good or bad, by yourself. You should not have others like parents or siblings suffering for your actions as well. If this is the result then, you were not ready to indulge. So if you are a 14 year old and you meet these prerequisites, then you might be ready for it.
 
 To argue along these lines will make a case for sex education starting at probably age ten or eleven, you know at that junction between childhood and puberty. I do not believe that the formal education system should leave such an important part of development to just the family because chances are that it never occurs there. Religious entities must also gain enough maturity to enable such education to take place in our schools. It is important when we consider that factors such as technology, STIs and the fact that there are many persons out there whose mental capacity would make young persons sexual prey.
 
 I also believe that we must not come out exclusively and say that all sex at age fourteen is wrong. We are the same societies who value the love of Romeo and Juliet. Juliet was 14 years old when she married and became intimate with Romeo. Do we ever hear anyone who is learned in the field of Literature or other arts coming out and saying that there was something wrong with Juliet? That she was in a fit of hormonal chaos? No, we do not; we hear instead that Juliet was mature compared to Romeo (an older person) and that the love they shared was pure. So we cannot say that one is to ready for sex at age fourteen.
 And I am sure that someone would want to come out and say that Romeo and Juliet were not real, but I present to you that whether or not they were real is not the issue as the tale represents a state of human thought and intellect. So we cannot dismiss the fact that there may be those who at age 14 who will be ready for sex.
 
 I also wish to draw to the readers' attention that in many parts of the world, there are laws which permit marriage at age fourteen, and consequently sex at this age as well. So there must be some reasoning behind it all depending on the culture of that people or circumstances. So the issue of age and sex also has a cultural twist.
 
 But the issue of age and sex as I said initially is not a straightforward right or wrong. We have to consider that in our world today, your young people are not safe. There are many sexual predators out there who may even prey on babies. At age fourteen, one may not even be safe. They are still vulnerable. Yes they might have the understanding that the person is taking advantage of them, but circumstances, both individual and social may permit these persons to continue to be victims of sex crimes. So as a society, we have to ensure that there are measures in place to prevent such things from happening. There might be laws, such as those adults to have sex with persons who are minors, that is to say below eighteen years old. But does that stop a number of teenage pregnancies in which the father is an adult? No.
 As societies, if we are determined to protect our young people form sexual consequences, we must create a society that would promote healthy sexual habits, not one that condemns sex at fourteen as being right or wrong and chooses to praise or ignore it. Because the reality is that it is going to happen no matter how much you preach against it. 
 
 My suggestions is that we implement laws that seek to protect our children form sexual predators out there, determine if a person met the prerequisite requirements for having sex, which I have suggested before punishment AND NOTE THIS, create an environment where young people would engage in fruitful activities instead of sex because they are bored.
 
 So, once more, I reiterate that sex at fourteen is not fully right or fully wrong, but relative. We have to recognize this if we wish to lover the adverse effects of sex at such an age.
 
 Happy Holidays!:)

 http://www.cnn.com/2007/US/04/03/school.sex.ap/index.html
 
 

 NEW ORLEANS, Louisiana (AP) -- Five fifth-grade students face criminal charges after authorities said four of them had sex in front of other students in an unsupervised classroom and kept a classmate posted as a lookout for teachers.
 
 The students were arrested Tuesday at the Spearsville school in rural north Louisiana, authorities said. Two 11-year-old girls, a 12-year-old boy and a 13-year old boy were charged with obscenity, a felony. An 11-year-old boy, the alleged lookout, was charged with being an accessory.
 
 "After 44 years of doing this work, nothing shocks me anymore," said Union Parish Sheriff Bob Buckley. "But this comes pretty close."
 
 Authorities said the incident happened March 27 at the school, which houses students from kindergarten through 12th grade. A high school teacher normally watches the fifth-grade class at the time, but went to an assembly for older students and the class was inadvertently left unattended, Buckley said. (Watch authorities try to determine if a crime was committed Video)
 
 The class, which had around 10 other students, was alone for about 15 minutes, he said.
 
 "When no teacher showed up, the four began to have sex in the classroom with the other elementary students in the classroom with them," he said.
